title: Add Link Sharing Feature with Copy Link and Social Share Options

requirements.text: Add a Link Share component that allows users to copy the current page URL to their clipboard via a 'Copy Link' button, with visual confirmation feedback (e.g., tooltip or button text change) after copying.

quotes: Iss website ma link share options nahi ha too add this feature
A website with a link sharing feature, including a Copy Link button

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Copy Link' button is visible on the page
Clicking it copies the current page URL to the clipboard
Visual feedback is shown after successful copy (e.g., button label changes to 'Copied!' for 2 seconds)

requirements.text: Add social share buttons for WhatsApp, Facebook, and Twitter/X that open the respective share dialogs in a new tab with the current page URL pre-filled as the shared link.

quotes: A website with a link sharing feature

acceptanceCriteria: Separate share buttons for WhatsApp, Facebook, and Twitter/X are visible
Clicking each button opens the corresponding platform's share URL in a new browser tab
The current page URL is pre-populated in the share dialog for each platform

requirements.text: Place the Link Share component (Copy Link + social share buttons) in a prominent, visible location such as the site header or a floating share bar so it is accessible from any page.

quotes: Share button placed in a visible location (e.g., header or content area)

acceptanceCriteria: The share component is visible without scrolling on all major pages
The component does not obstruct primary content
The component is responsive and works on both mobile and desktop layouts

constraints: Social sharing must use standard web share URLs (no third-party SDKs or external APIs)
Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Backend changes are not required for this feature
No new authentication or coin-gating for the share feature
No native Web Share API integration (stick to URL-based sharing links)
